Summary It's a popular myth that no one reads on the internet. The reality is that people only read what's most relevant to them in a given context. This can be a single word or a short phrase, an action or an instruction, a complete idea or a link to more. The deeply relevant, highly contextual copy that people encounter during their online experience, the copy that blends almost invisibly into the background of an effortless user experience, is provided by copywriters like me.  
 
As a UX copywriter my work often falls within the minutia of creating the user experience, but I do so with the benefit of a big picture view, often informed by being included in the concepting, ideation and decision making of multiple teams and projects.  
 
During my time as a copywriter I have worked primarily with medium to large companies, developing interactive content, including both user interface and marketing copy.  
 
My goal is always to make that content easy to read, easy to understand and appropriate for the audience, brand, and communication channel.  
 
I work well independently, but more often I work collaboratively with a creative team. I have been fortunate to work closely with, and learn from, other skilled professionals. This not only includes other writers and editors, but many designers, information architects and developers, as well as project managers, marketers, attorneys, and management at all levels. 
 
Specialties: User experience, interactive content, content strategy, marketing and communications.
